lines.text: A penny for your thoughts, Mr. Kehoe.
I wouldn't trust you with a snowblower in a blizzard.
Hey, how'd you like to ride over to Wagon Mount with me and make $2?
I've already got $2, thanks all the same.
I never put a dime on anybody but myself. I haven't lost yet.
As long as you're goin' to Wagon Mount, I'll buy you your last drink.
lines.character: Bartender of Rosebud Saloon in Touchstone

lines.text:
[Paying for his own drink]
Thanks, but that one hasn't been put in the bottle yet.

[to Ma]
I'm all played out. I couldn't beat my mother from a standing start. You're all the luck I got.
